message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.MM, cs.IR, cs.LG 

The paper deals with the problem of video understanding, which is a subfield of computer vision (cs.CV). The use of language to formulate video understanding as the task of captioning or description suggests a connection to natural language processing (cs.CL). The need for sophisticated metrics for evaluating video description performance suggests a connection to multimedia (cs.MM) and information retrieval (cs.IR). Finally, the testing of different approaches on a benchmark dataset suggests a connection to machine learning (cs.LG).
